abstract: As Kenneth R. Feinberg, the Obama administration’s executive pay czar, reportedly gears up to disclose the salaries for highly paid employees, including those at Citigroup, the bank’s chief, Vikram Pandit, addressed some of the hot-button compensation packages awarded to his employees.

lead_paragraph: As Kenneth R. Feinberg, the Obama administration’s executive pay czar, reportedly gears up to disclose the salaries for the 25 most highly paid employees at government-assisted companies such as Citigroup, Citi’s chief, Vikram Pandit, addressed some of the hot-button compensation packages awarded to his employees.

headline.main: Citi Chief: $100 Million in Annual Pay Is Too Much
